sub_title: Connecting the Unconnected | Founder INSPIR8ION 🇳🇱,  DIGIE 🇪🇺 | Co-founder DronePortRotterdam 🛰 | Founder Rotterdam Serious Games Summit 🎮 | Based in Rotterdam 🌍 #WeMakeItHappen
summary:
Sinds 1 juli 2016 helpt INSPIR8ION opdrachtgevers in het publieke en private domein met het bieden van tastbare en toekomstbestendige oplossingen voor sociaal-maatschappelijke, wetenschappelijke en zakelijke uitdagingen in de 21e eeuw. Digitalisering, Europa en Duurzaamheid staan centraal in de aanpak van INSPIR8ION. 

In een continu veranderende wereld zorgen wij voor verbinding tussen mensen, inhoud (leidende agenda’s), technologie en netwerken, introduceren wij nieuwe concepten, bouwen wij nieuwe of heractiveren wij bestaande ecosystemen en vertellen wij de verhalen van onze opdrachtgevers op een inspirerende manier dankzij pakkende teksten en bijpassende beelden. 

INSPIR8ION biedt de volgende diensten: management, advies, training en onderzoek.

Since 1 July 2016, INSPIR8ION has been helping clients in the public and private sector to offer tangible and future-proof solutions for social, scientific and business challenges in the 21st century. Digitisation, Europe and Sustainability are central to INSPIR8ION's approach. In a continuously changing world we ensure connections between people, content (leading agendas), technology and networks, we introduce new concepts, we build new or reactivate existing ecosystems and we tell the stories of our clients in an inspiring way thanks to catchy texts and matching images.

INSPIR8ION offers the following services: management, consultancy, training and research.

school.name: De Haagse Hogeschool / The Hague University of Applied Sciences

profile_positions.description:
WELCOME AT DRONEPORT!
Where we make things happen at the intersection of Cities, Ports, and Airports.

DronePort Rotterdam originated as a concept between Arthur Dallau and Niels Kalshoven, both active in the field of Innovative Air Mobility and frequently approached with questions regarding the organisation and integration of drones into existing systems. While exploring the challenges of everyday scenarios, it quickly became apparent to both gentlemen that there was a lack of an overarching strategy that addressed this complexity. A strategy was needed that encompassed the entire mobility ecosystem and all its layers to strengthen the system.

By mapping out the various components, the concept of vertical integration, one of the pillars of DronePort, was soon realised. Collaborating with a multitude of stakeholders highlighted the critical need for developing solutions for the port, city, and airport. In the Rotterdam region, it is vital that these hubs collaboratively develop crucial infrastructure, enabling autonomous uncrewed assets to integrate into the mobility and transport system.

DronePort Rotterdam envisions a future where the integration of drones and other autonomous and uncrewed systems into the European airspace is not just a possibility, but a reality that drives economic growth, ensures safety and security, and promotes sustainability. Europe focuses on a twin green and digital transition, DronePort Rotterdam positions itself as a key-enabler of this transformation, harnessing the capabilities of autonomous and uncrewed assets to expedite the decarbonisation and digital transformation of the comprehensive transport and mobility system.
profile_positions.title: Co-founder

profile_positions.title: Founder and CEO

profile_positions.description: INSPIR8ION has joined the EIT Urban Mobility network as member of the Special Interest Group on Urban Air Mobility. Together with EIT Urban Mobility HQ and the Hub West we will work on connecting governments, industry, knowledge institutions and society, and introduce, validate and scale uses cases in relation to Urban Air Mobility. Furthermore, we will focus on creating the right business conditions to ensure the sustainable development of Urban Air Mobility, and promote a safe and secure integration of UAM in cities and regions across Europe. EIT Urban Mobility is an initiative of the European Institute of Innovation and Technology (EIT), a body of the European Union. EIT Urban Mobility is a growing pan-European partnership bringing together businesses, education, research excellence institutions and multifaceted cities. Its aim is to facilitate and fund the collaboration between these players to create mobility solutions that will accelerate the transition towards more liveable urban spaces.
profile_positions.title: Partner

profile_positions.description:
English
To realize the full potential of drones and future passenger transport by air (Urban Air Mobility) for the Netherlands, smart and sustainable solutions will have to be developed. Developing these solutions requires close cooperation and the will to innovate together by doing. That is why leading parties have joined forces and founded the Dutch Drone Delta.

The coalition consists of partners who have the necessary knowledge, skills, experience and strength to realize applications with drones and to work on the future of Urban Air Mobility. The Dutch Drone Delta includes the following partners: KLM, Air Traffic Control the Netherlands (LVNL), Schiphol, Port of Rotterdam, KPN, NS, ANWB, Umanned Valley, Transavia, NLR, a.s.r. General Insurance, Moving Dot, RAI, Connekt, Antea Group, Space53, NLR, Achmea, AirHub, Rijkswaterstaat, Ministry of Infrastructure and Water Management, City of Amsterdam and INSPIR8ION.

Nederlands
Om de volledige potentie van drones en het toekomstige personen vervoer door de lucht (Urban Air Mobility) voor Nederland te realiseren zullen slimme en duurzame oplossingen moeten worden ontwikkeld. Het ontwikkelen van deze oplossingen vraagt om nauwe samenwerking en de wil om samen te innoveren door te doen. Daarom hebben toonaangevende partijen de handen ineengeslagen en de Dutch Drone Delta opgericht.

 De coalitie bestaat uit partners die de benodigde kennis, kunde, ervaring en slagkracht hebben om toepassingen met drones te realiseren en te werken aan de toekomst van Urban Air Mobility. De Dutch Drone Delta bestaat onder andere uit de volgende partners: KLM, Luchtverkeersleiding Nederland (LVNL), Schiphol, Port of Rotterdam, KPN, NS, ANWB, Umanned Valley, Transavia, NLR,  a.s.r. Schadeverzekeringen, Moving Dot, RAI, Connekt, Antea Group, Space53, NLR, Achmea, AirHub, ministerie van Infrastructuur en Waterstaat, Rijkswaterstaat, Gemeente Amsterdam en INSPIR8ION.
profile_positions.title: Partner

profile_positions.description:
FLYING FORWARD 2020
Creating the 21st Century Spatial Ecosystem

Flying Forward 2020 is a three-year collaborative research project that will develop a new Urban Air Mobility (UAM) ecosystem aligned with the Digital Government Transformation (DGT) of European countries, which focuses on incorporating Urban Air Mobility within the geospatial data infrastructure of cities. Building and incorporating all related data from UAM infrastructures and operations within the digital infrastructure of cities will allow helping society to fly forward in a safe, secure and effective way. This will make life easier, cheaper and provide more opportunities by getting products faster and more efficiently across Europe.


FF2020 offers an entire state-of-the-art geospatial UAM ecosystem which includes a governance model and framework (interoperable and scalable); regulatory framework (machine readable and executable); geospatial digital infrastructure (technology agnostic digital toolbox); Identity of Things Scheme (identity framework for operators, drones and authorities); and interoperability frameworks (technical, semantic, legal, policy and organisational) – which fully comply with existing EU-regulation and yet challenges these regulations by providing new insights.

In my role as Impact Coordinator I am responsible for Work Packages 3 and 7 and the exploitation of the project's results

For more information go to: www.ff2020.eu
profile_positions.title: Impact Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
The interaction between humans (human to human, human to machine) and machines (machine to machine) is changing, fast. New technologies have changed the way we communicate and interact entirely. We call this transformation the Digital Interaction Evolution, also known as Digie. 

This evolution challenges companies, cities and governments on a daily basis. Shaping the future is everyone’s goal, but how do you reach that goal and have you got what is needed to stay relevant in the digital age? These and many other questions can be answered by our team of purpose-driven digital leaders who have earned their credits by successfully transforming companies, governments, cities and entire ecosystems. 

We believe in sustainable (safe, secure and convenient) solutions with a positive (societal) impact that enables and ensures trust in the digital age. Digie is the new kid on the block that takes boutique consultancy to another level. Let us help you become the digital leader that your customers, citizens and clients deserve. Together we empower the people through digital trust. We help you meet or set the standards on a global level!
profile_positions.title: Managing Partner

profile_positions.description:
The “United for Smart Sustainable Cities” (U4SSC) is  a UN initiative coordinated by ITU and UNECE and supported by CBD, ECLAC, FAO, ITU, UNDP, UNECA, UNECE, UNESCO, UN Environment, UNEP-FI, UNFCCC, UN-Habitat, UNIDO, UNU-EGOV, UN-Women and WMO to achieve Sustainable Development Goal 11: "Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable".

U4SSC serves as the global platform to advocate for public policy and to encourage the use of ICTs to facilitate and ease the transition to smart sustainable cities.

itsme®, your digital ID, to log in securely, to share your ID data or to sign by using your smartphone!

profile_positions.title: Certified Strategic Partner

profile_positions.description:
EUROCITIES was founded in 1986 by the mayors of six large cities: Barcelona, Birmingham, Frankfurt, Lyon, Milan and Rotterdam.

Today, we bring together the local governments of over 140 of Europe's largest cities and over 45 partner cities, that between them govern 130 million citizens across 39 countries. 

Digital solutions empowered by data produced in our cities are key to solve many of the most urgent urban challenges including sustainable urban mobility, energy efficiency, housing, healthcare, reducing digital divide while leverage economic growth for all ecosystem players.

Over a decade, several smart and sustainable solutions have been developed and tested in our cities. However, limited resources, legal and governmental barriers, technological skills shortage, lack of common methodology and innovation potential prevent or hinder the large upscale and uptake of those solutions - such as interoperable digital platforms and services - in Europe, preventing citizens to benefit from more innovative, high-quality and cost-effective services.

To fill this gap, EUROCITIES  launched the Knowledge Society Forum (KSF). Joining forces with the European Commission, member states, the European Committee of the Regions and the main organisations and networks of cities to boost sustainable digital transformation in cities and communities in the EU and develop of a methodology to scale existing digital solutions between cities. We call this the KSF LAB. In 2020 the KSF LAB launches its first pilot project: The Citizen Card.

The project is aimed at developing and scaling up the Zaragoza and Gijon’s models of a citizen card as instrument for cities to provide inclusive digital solutions to their citizens. The card is a scalable solution which enables the city and businesses to add extra services on the ‘platform’. The following cities take part in this project: Porto, Bratislava, Pau, Eindhoven, Rotterdam, Zaragoza, Gijon, Valladolid, Barcelona, and Ghent
profile_positions.title: Expert in Urban Digital Strategies and Services

profile_positions.description:
De Toekomst Begint NU (DTBN) maakt gemeenten en verenigingen klaar voor de toekomst. Dit doen we niet vóór maar mét jullie, als gelijkwaardige partners. We adviseren, trainen, organiseren en positioneren. Met innovatie- en verbindingskracht. Altijd met dezelfde betrokkenheid en een scherp oog voor menselijk contact. Zo creëren we structurele oplossingen met impact.

Wij zijn Patrick Nelen en Arthur Dallau, samen goed voor ruim veertig jaar ervaring bij overheidsorganisaties en verenigingen, in verschillende functies. Als veranderaars in hart en nieren, ondersteunen we organisaties bij het innovatief organiseren. Dit doen we elk vanuit een eigen onderneming: [IDEALITER ] en [INSPIR8ION ]. In díe hoedanigheid bundelden we in 2017 onze krachten voor ‘De Toekomst Begint NU’ (DTBN). 

Gemeenten en verenigingen staan oog in oog met verandering. Het is dan ook niet de vraag óf, maar hóe je meebeweegt richting de toekomst. Het gedachtegoed van DTBN omarmt deze uitdaging; het biedt namelijk unieke kansen voor groei en ontwikkeling. Altijd. Sommige organisaties hebben alleen een duwtje in de juiste richting nodig om dat te zien. Dat is wat wij doen en waar we goed in zijn. 

Wacht niet te lang, want De Toekomst Begint NU!
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder
